Title: National Grid to sell Grain LNG to streamline business
Description: The UK's National Grid intends to sell its wholly owned 14.3 mtpa Grain LNG import terminal to streamline its business and shift focus to networks.
Author: JS

Title: Petronas confirms a return to full operations at Bintulu LNG
Description: The Petronas-operated 29.2 mtpa Bintulu LNG export facility in Malaysia has returned to full operations since May 19, following a power loss on May 10.
Author: CK

Title: Hoegh LNG sees FSRU demand remaining strong, supply tight
Description: Floating LNG infrastructure provider Hoegh LNG expects demand for floating storage regasification units to stay strong, with the prompt availability of only one FSRU in the market highlighting the strength of demand.
Author: CK

Title: Japan is expected to seek more spot LNG for summer even amid rising stock levels
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities climbed to a five-week high for the week that ended May 19, and market participants expect more stocks to be built through spot LNG purchases for July and August to cater to summer power demand with the season expected to be hotter than normal this year.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina’s Enarsa issues its third LNG tender for the year, seeks eight cargoes
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, has issued a tender seeking eight cargoes to be delivered between July and August to its 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG receiving terminal. The tender closes on May 28.
Author: CK
